title.narrative: Return and Reintegration Assistance for Migrants and Governments (RR)

description.narrative: Pakistan has one of the largest diaspora populations in the world, with Pakistani migrant workers residing in over 115 countries. Return migration to Pakistan also remains a persistent phenomenon and due to limited technical and financial resources of the national Government, COVID-19 has exacerbated reintegration challenges for Pakistan as over 94,000 Pakistani migrant workers returned to the country last year and continue to face challenges of social and economic reintegration. 75 percent of returnees are below the age of 40 and were previously employed in low-skilled and semi-skilled jobs. Therefore, their low technical and vocational skills present a major challenge for their reintegration in Pakistan as well as future re-migration for better economic prospects. In light of the above, the proposed project will aim to enhance social and economic resilience of vulnerable returning Pakistani migrants using a right based and gender sensitive approach and under the following two broad outcomes: Outcome 1: Returning migrants and their communities demonstrate increased awareness of available reintegration assistance mechanisms through which they can improve their income and livelihood options Outcome 2: Returning migrants and their families have access to psychosocial assistance, skill building trainings and start up support to improve their livelihood opportunities.

participating-org.narrative: GIZ - Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH

mailing-address.narrative: Plot No 4C Sector G-5/5 , Diplomatic Enclave, Islamabad 44000, Pakistan

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Project with some but insufficient inclusion of gender issues

provider-org.narrative: GIZ - Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Internationale Zusammenarbeit GmbH
